comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: This is George Melrose, Surveyor who family historians credit with surveying the engineering masterpiece that is the Zig Zag railway. Which reminds me of what has long been one of my favourite photos - "66. [Steam engine hangs over a cliff: on 4 Apr 1901, no. 2542, then 246 of the B205 class, was heading a goods down the 1 in 42 grade between Clarence and Top Points on the Great Zig Zag above Lithgow when it got out of control, burst through a rocky parapet and stopped 65 m. up]"

comment.author: 47201412@N02
comment._content: Unclaimed remains were relocated to Bunnerong Cemetery, now re-branded Pioneer Memorial Park. From Town Hall to Devonshire Street to Bunnerong - some of the remains probably moved place of burial more often than they moved house when they were alive! Devonshire Street is now the pedestrian underpass that links Elizabeth Street with Railway Square.

comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/pellethepoet] Thanks for this info + the link to the George Melrose webpage, we'll update the caption. 

So glad you included a link to that steam engine from SLNSW - a real cliffhanger, wouldn't you say!

Sorry for the delay in responding, sometimes these slip past unseen....but we get to them eventually.
